details.reasoning: The user asked to post the summary to Slack. The 'slack_post_message' action corresponds to Slack's chat.postMessage and requires 'channel' and 'text'. We map slack_channel to channel and summary to text per the API docs.
details.rendered_config: { "channel": "#product-alerts", "text": "Found 3 products. Average price: $91.66. Lowest: USB-C Hub ($45.00)" }

details.request: Add these products to my Notion database
details.reasoning: To add items to a Notion database, we need to create pages in that database. The 'notion_create_page' action matches this need per the Notion Create Page API. Using the provided notion_database_id as the parent and the scraper_results array, we generate one page payload per product with properties Name (title), Price (number), and URL (url). The Liquid loop outputs a JSON array of valid Notion page-create payloads, enabling one page per product to be created.
details.proposed_config: [{% for product in scraper_results %}{ "parent": { "database_id": "{{ notion_database_id }}" }, "properties": { "Name": { "title": [ { "text": { "content": "{{ product.name }}" } } ] }, "Price": { "number": {{ product.price }} }, "URL": { "url": "{{ product.url }}" } } }{% unless forloop.last %}, {% endunless %}{% endfor %}]

details.request: Create a GitHub issue for the failed scrape
details.reasoning: The user wants to create a GitHub issue for a failed scrape. The 'github_create_issue' action is designed for creating issues. According to the API docs, a 'title' is required and 'body' and 'labels' are optional. I used the provided variables (summary and error_details) to populate the issue body and added appropriate labels.
details.rendered_config:
{ "title": "Scrape Failed - Automated Report", "body": "## Summary

Scrape failed: Connection timeout after 30s. URL: https://store.example.com

## Error Details

TimeoutError: Request exceeded 30000ms

---
*This issue was automatically created by the Integration Agent.*", "labels": ["bug", "automated", "scraper"] }

details.request: Add these results to the existing spreadsheet
details.reasoning: The user wants to add rows to an existing Google Sheet and a spreadsheet_id is provided. The 'google_sheets_append' action (spreadsheets.values.append) is designed to append multiple rows. The config uses the provided spreadsheet_id and loops through scraper_results to build the values array, matching the API's expected payload.
details.proposed_config: { "spreadsheetId": "{{ spreadsheet_id }}", "range": "Sheet1!A:C", "valueInputOption": "USER_ENTERED", "values": [{% for product in scraper_results %}["{{ product.name }}", {{ product.price }}, "{{ product.url }}"]{% unless forloop.last %}, {% endunless %}{% endfor %}] }
